Posted By: THalbrook (5/6/2011 9:11:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The general of my new EDH deck! Fun times with [Konda's Banner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Konda's Banner), [Leonin Shikari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Shikari) + [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves), [Stonehewer Giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stonehewer Giant), [Taj-Nar Swordsmith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Taj-Nar Swordsmith)...  
  
And jeez, get your minds out of the gutter you guys! The flavor text tells the story: she's acting as Regent in [Raksha Golden Cub](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raksha Golden Cub)'s absence. She takes up the Kha's regalia and unites the shattered pride (the tokens) around her. It's actually a pretty flavorful card.  
  
That said, she is certainly, um, athletic.
posts.html:

Posted By: GengilOrbios (6/29/2011 7:22:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She's my EDH general, and she's a beast. I gave her a [Darksteel Plate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Plate) in a recent game, and she stuck around the whole game. Eventually, my [Puresteel Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puresteel Paladin) tossed a bunch of other equipment on her, including, among other things, [Accorder's Shield](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Accorder's Shield), [Sword of War and Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of War and Peace), [Whispersilk Cloak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Whispersilk Cloak), [Sword of Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Vengeance) and [Loxodon Warhammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Loxodon Warhammer). So she played impeccable offense and defense in addition to being a token factory.
  
   
It's tough, though, to imagine that situation flavor-wise. I picture her all weighed down will all of this equipment, maybe carrying them all in a big duffle bag, eventually resorting to throwing stuff at her enemies.
posts.html:
She's my EDH general, and she's a beast. I gave her a Darksteel Plate in a recent game, and she stuck around the whole game. Eventually, my Puresteel Paladin tossed a bunch of other equipment on her, including, among other things, Accorder's Shield, Sword of War and Peace, Whispersilk Cloak, Sword of Vengeance and Loxodon Warhammer. So she played impeccable offense and defense in addition to being a token factory.

It's tough, though, to imagine that situation flavor-wise. I picture her all weighed down will all of this equipment, maybe carrying them all in a big duffle bag, eventually resorting to throwing stuff at her enemies.

Posted By: Sironos (6/6/2011 1:38:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She is pretty crappy at attacking, and yet she wants to hoard all of your equipment.  
There are a few Equip: ![0](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=0&type=symbol) cards that let you move lots of them: [Shuko](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shuko), [Umbral Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Umbral Mantle), [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves).  
The mantle is pretty sucky without a combo though. It is free to equip because it does nothing until you put mana into it.  
[Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter) and [Cranial Plating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cranial Plating) are both powerful and cheap to move.  
This is a tricky card to play because you put lots of eggs in a basket when you start piling equipment onto her.
posts.html:
She is pretty crappy at attacking, and yet she wants to hoard all of your equipment.
There are a few Equip: cards that let you move lots of them: Shuko, Umbral Mantle, Lightning Greaves.
The mantle is pretty sucky without a combo though. It is free to equip because it does nothing until you put mana into it.
Bonesplitter and Cranial Plating are both powerful and cheap to move.
This is a tricky card to play because you put lots of eggs in a basket when you start piling equipment onto her.
